entry.p: Fatigue Management allows you to create fatigue rules to manage over communication with profiles. Fatigue rules are easily built, but are extremely flexible with capabilities such as counting messages across multiple channels (including transactional messages), only counting specific deliveries, or applying rules to specific profiles.

Import from a URL enables you to quickly retrieve your creative content from a website to build emails for any delivery. Additionally, you can streamline your creative process by enabling third parties to share content directly through a URL. Imported content can be flexibly used as part of a single delivery or at the template level ensuring brand consistency for all related campaigns whether they be workflow-based or transactional messages, and include A/B or multivariate testing. Import from a URL automatically converts and tracks all links to monitor email performance through Dynamic Reporting.

body.p: Detailed information on these features is available at Adobe Campaign Release Notes.
Product documentation is available at Adobe Campaign Standard Documentation.
To learn more about Adobe Campaign, enable yourself at Adobe Digital Library.
New features, updates, and fixes to Mobile Services:

li.p: Support for Adobe Analytics virtual report suites. (released October 26, 2017)or more information about virtual report suites, see Virtual Report Suites.
Push messaging support for recurring scheduling.

body.p: For more information about scheduling recurring push messages, see Schedule: Push Messages.

li.p: Login updated with Adobe Identity Management System (IMS) integration

body.p: For more information about the updated signing in process, see Signing In.
For more information, see Adobe Target Preview.

li.p: Target enhancement for allowing pre-fetching of experience data
For more information, see Prefetch offer content in Android and Prefetch offer content in iOS.
The Xamarin plugin for iOS and Android has been updated to version 4.13.8.
